application_type_full: Tree works: Trees in conservation areas/subject to TPOs
description: To carry out tree surgery including a crown reduction by 4m to One Copper Beech, T43 on TPO 85a
decision_conditions: The Copper Beech is situated within the rear garden of 13 Arden Mhor. This tree is a large specimen with a mature and attractive crown which is visible from multiple corners, including properties within Arden Mhor and Catlin's Lane. The tree has a high-to-very-high amenity value and provides a great contribution to the arboreal character of the local area, enriched by its mature tree canopy cover.

The crown of this Beech appears healthy and in good condition. A crown reduction by 4m of this tree is considered excessive and no arboricultural reasons have been supplied to justify the proposed works.

Pruning would unnecessarily introduce large multiple wounds into the crown, which would likely cause stress and lead to infection, potentially altering the long-term health of the tree. This would impact the safe useful life expectancy of this tree. Pruning would also result in weakly attached re-growth forming that would be prone to future failure.
The proposed work to reduce the crown will
The removal of deadwood, dangerous / hanging branches and ivy:  This does not require the formal consent of the Council.
Wildlife and Countryside Act 1981:  Note that it is an offence under this act to disturb roosting bats, nesting birds or any other protected species.
